name: Dragon Palace

Cetuspeanna beams at your suggestion and holds you close, surrounding you with the familiar shimmering shield.

I found it sunken deep inside one of the ocean trenches about halfway to Fertilia.

The vessel was mostly intact, sans a large hole in the bottom, and the mermaids offered to repair it.
Then a friend suggested we make a place where it could float... but underwater.
Sounds complicated, right? We even invited a Voltlin to design this room... She was excited at first, but later said it was impossible... At least, without magic.
Thankfully, I am pretty good at magic, so we got it to work. Now there is an enchantment on this room that prevents too much water from entering.

That is true. It was a... hobby project? I do realize it is not a very practical thing to have.

After the barrier went up and relations with humans became less... strained, I reported this ship to the adventurers' guild. They were very happy to receive some of the items I found inside that were still intact. Some documents in particular.
I was even paid, and they also let me keep the ship itself to boot.♪
Oh, and now we have a nice secret place we can use to hang out together! See, it's getting some use even now.
And it is also the place where I keep my... hoard.
Yes... Before I discovered I was actually a strange sea slug, I really considered myself a dragon. Hoarding was something I thought I had to do, as a part of my dragon identity.
Truth be told, I don't think it ever truly excited me, but I couldn't admit it to myself...
Later, I would give most of the hoard away. I prefer items being used, rather than simply being collected and gathering dust.
So what remains now is just a pile of really odd items that nobody wanted... I don't really look at it often either.
